TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed NWConnectionState extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Describes the state of the network connection, provided to your state changed handler in your .
Docs.remarks: You can provide a state changed handler by calling the method and the provided method will be called with the current status of the connection.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Network.NWConnectionState Cancelled = int32(5)

Docs.summary: The connection was cancelled by application code.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Network.NWConnectionState Failed = int32(4)

Docs.summary: The connection has failed, could be due to the other end point terminating the connection or a network failure.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Network.NWConnectionState Invalid = int32(0)

Docs.summary: This is the initial state of the connection - this value is never delivered to your state change handler.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Network.NWConnectionState Preparing = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The connection is being prepared to be used. The connection can then transition back to Waiting or to Ready.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Network.NWConnectionState Ready = int32(3)

Docs.summary: The connection is ready and can be used to send and receive data. The connection can then transition to Failed or Canceled.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Network.NWConnectionState Waiting = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The connection is waiting for the network to be ready, this can happen if the radio transmitter needs to be activated and the connection is wainting for the radio to be ready. From this state, the connection will transition to Preparing.
